history.text: How's your day going?
It's great! Have you seen Maleficent from 2014?
I did not see that movie. That's the one with Angelina Jolie, right?
Yes it has Angelina Jolie, Sharito Copley, Elle Fanning and Sam Riley.
Is the sequel to that movie The Huntsman with Chris Hemsworth? That was a dreadful movie.
But I did hear good things about Maleficent. Is it the Snow White tale from the bad lady's point of view?
No, I don't think so. It's loosely based on Walt Disney's Sleeping Beauty. It shows the story of the antagonist, showing her conflicted relationship with the princess.
Oh, ok. And what was her relationship with the princess?
I'm not sure her exact relationship with Princess Aurora, but she is not fond of her and places a spell on her to prick her finger on her 16th birthday.
Probably the old "she's prettier than I am" issue that old queens seem to get. Seems like a pretty dark movie.
It is unexpectedly entertaining to watch due to the title character.
Maleficent is a powerful fairy in a magical forest realm neighboring a human kingdom.
I am liking the live action movies that they have started coming out with. Jungle Book was great. Did they keep the scene with the dragon in this movie like they had in the animated version?

I am not sure if I remember that, but Maleficent fell in love with a peasant when she was a young girl. His love for her was overshadowed by his ambition and they grow apart and Maleficent becomes the protector of the Moors.
Oh, I see. Eventually she becomes jealous of the 16 year old girl. Kind of a change in roles for Angelina, how does she hold up?

Angelina gloriously personifies her role as Maleficent. There are lots of levitating cliffs and odd plants, but despite the bleeding edge design the backgrounds have of th old matte painted backgrounds of the analog days.
Nice. Kind of stayed true to the roots of old, unlike some of these over done effects we often see nowadays, ahem, Michael Bay.
Yes it very much stayed true to the roots of the original.    It was directed by Robert Stromberg and is considered a super hero film genre.
Has he done any other films?

I don't know for sure, but as the movie continues Maleficent begins to care for Aurora despite her strong dislike for her. She does that since the pixies that are to be watching over her fail to do so.
So she turns good in the end?
She does desperately try to undo the curse and Aurora asks to live with Maleficent and the Moors just days before her 16th birthday.
Kind of a fate thing....it was bound to happen. It sounds like a pretty good movie, I may have to check it out. Is Maleficent like an all powerful being?
It is a pretty good flick. She can change people into dragons and has wings to fly. She is pretty interesting character.
I think it is worth a watch.
I'll have to check it out. Is it on Netflix or Amazon Prime?
I am not sure that is something to check though. I hope you are able to watch it.
It got a CinemaScore:A
Nice. I will add this to my movies to watch list. Nice chatting with you!
Great! Nice chatting with you also!
Gppdbye
Goodbye.

uid1response.feedback: User 2 made the movie seem pretty good. I would also like to see Angelina Jolie in this role.
